dirs.work: this directory is used for different auxiliary results and components debug messages
dirs.results: this is a directory, in which reports and archives with results will be placed

cpachecker.unreachability: abs path to CPAchecker branch ldv-bam
cpachecker.coverage: abs path to CPAchecker branch ldv-bam
cpachecker.memsafety: abs path to CPAchecker branch smg_witness_for_ldv
cpachecker.races: abs path to CPAchecker branch races

sources.source dir: absolute path to the source directory 1
sources.build patch: patch, which will be applied to the source directory 1 before building
patches: list of patches, which will be applied to the source directory 1 after building
sources.skip: if true, then source directory 1 will not be changed (this step will be skipped)

build config.make clean command: make clean command for source directory 1
build config.clade config: absolute path to Clade configuration, under which the building will be performed for source directory 1
build config.fail if build fails: if true, then Builder will not stop on any error during execution of build command (default is false)
build config.clean sources: if true, then Builder will clean the source directory before building

sources.cached commands: absolute path to cached json-file with build commands

sources.source dir: absolute path to the source directory N
sources.branch: branch of the source repository N
sources.build patch: patch, which will be applied to the source directory N before building
patches: list of patches, which will be applied to the source directory N after building
sources.skip: if true, then source directory N will not be changed (this step will be skipped)

build config.make command: make command for source directory N
build config.make clean command: make clean command for source directory N
build config.clade config: absolute path to Clade configuration, under which the building will be performed for source directory N
build config.fail if build fails: if true, then Builder will not stop on any error during execution of build command (default is false)
build config.clean sources: if true, then Builder will clean the source directory before building

sources.cached commands: absolute path to cached json-file with build commands

Builder.debug: on true will produce more information on Builder component

Generator.print prototypes: boolean - print prototypes for entry point calls in main file (true by default)
Generator.ignore types: boolean - ignore types of parameters in entry point calls in main file (false by default)

strategies.rule 1: redefine main generator strategy for rule 1
strategies.rule N: redefine main generator strategy for rule N

filter black list: list of patterns, which should be excluded while processing build commands
filter white list: list of patterns, which should not be excluded while processing build commands
extra options: list of compiler options, which should be added to compilation commands
Preparator.preprocessor: preprocessor command (gcc by default, 'command' - use build command preprocessor)
Preparator.resolve missed proto: if true, then functions with missed prototypes in CIL file will be resolved
Preparator.strategy: strategy for preparation of verification tasks ('subsystem' - join all commands for specified subdirectory, 'library' - create verification task for each library)
Preparator.path: path to preprocessor (if option preprocessor is not default)
Preparator.use cil: if true, then CIL will be used to merge all obtained build commands (default)
Preparator.files suffix: suffix for build command files, which are passed to CIL (by default is empty)
Preparator.debug: true|false - overwrites debug value for script preparation.py

Launcher.scheduler: local - use local machine for launches, cloud - use preconfigured cloud
Launcher.statistics time: time in seconds, which will be allocated for printing statistics during each verifier launch (this time will be subtracted from the CPU time limit)
Launcher.backup write: if true, then copy all progress in backup file during verification process (this may cause some overheads, but is recommended for long launches), false by default
Launcher.backup read: if true, then read previously written backup file and restore progress (working directory must remain unchanged), false by default
Launcher.parallel launches: rewrite the number of parallel verification launches (should be used carefully)

Exporter.version: name of the checked system along with its version
Exporter.add verifier logs: if true, then verifier logs will be exported for each unknown result
Exporter.debug: true|false - overwrites debug value for script export_results.py
Exporter.timestamp: timestamp, which is produced by launcher in the following format: %Y_%m_%d_%H_%M_%S (only relevant for launching export_results.py separately)

cloud.master: host, on which cloud master is running

uploader.upload results: if true, then results will be automatically uploaded into the server (Klever web-interface)
uploader.parent id: if true, then the given identifier will be treated as parent job identifier
uploader.user: valid user name on the server (this user should have access for this job identifier)
uploader.name: name of the report to be uploaded

rule 1.additional model functions: path to the file with additional model functions (for rule 1)

rule N.additional model functions: path to the file with additional model functions (for rule N)

MEA.additional model functions: path to the file with additional model functions (for none-specified rules)
MEA.debug: true|false - overwrites debug value for MEA

Coverage.mode: none - do not compute coverage, percent - only upload coverage percent, full - upload full coverage
Coverage.debug: true|false - overwrites debug value for Coverage component

system: identifier of a system under verification (subdirectories with this id must present)
entrypoints desc: list of paths to the files with description of entry points (files are searched in the entrypoints directory)
commits: list of commits, which should be checked - only relevant callers for each commit will be checked
callers: list of callers, which should be checked (all other callers in the specified subsystems will be ignored), does not work with 'commits' tag
debug: true|false - print debug messages and do not remove auxiliary files in the main script on not
cached: true|false - use obtained before CIL-files (is aimed at debug)
find coverage: if true (default), then coverage will be calculated as well for each entrypoint
runexec: true|false - do not use RunExec as a command wrapper in case of false (default is true)
preparation config: redefine file name with preparation config (by default is conf.json)
